intro.p: Provide useful helpers to be used in a layout view or in the wizards steps views.

section.title: WizardHelper()
section.p: Initializes a new instance of the Castle.MonoRail.Framework.Helpers.WizardHelper class.

tr.td: Returns the name of the previous step
Returns the name of the next step

section.title: SetController(Castle.MonoRail.Framework.Controller controller)
section.p: Sets the controller.

section.title: HasNextStep() : System.Boolean
section.p: Returns true if the current wizard flow has a next step.

section.title: HasPreviousStep() : System.Boolean
section.p: Returns true if the current wizard flow has an accessible previous step.

note.p: This will only return true if not the first step

p.p: Creates an anchor tag (link) to the specified step.

section.title: LinkToStep(System.String linkText, Castle.MonoRail.Framework.WizardStepPage step, System.Object id) : System.String

p.p: Creates an anchor tag (link) to the specified step.

tr.td: Object to use for the action ID argument.

section.title: LinkToStep(System.String linkText, Castle.MonoRail.Framework.WizardStepPage step, System.Object id, System.Collections.IDictionary attributes) : System.String

p.p: Creates an anchor tag (link) to the specified step.

tr.td: Object to use for the action ID argument.
Additional attributes for the a tag.

p.p: Creates an anchor tag (link) to the next step.

note.p: This helper assumes there is a next step. It's advised that you use Castle.MonoRail.Framework.Helpers.WizardHelper.HasNextStep before calling this

p.p: Creates an anchor tag (link) to the next step.

note.p: This helper assumes there is a next step. It's advised that you use Castle.MonoRail.Framework.Helpers.WizardHelper.HasNextStep before calling this

tr.td: Additional attributes for the a tag.

p.p: Creates an anchor tag (link) with an id attribute to the next step.

note.p: This helper assumes there is a next step. It's advised that you use Castle.MonoRail.Framework.Helpers.WizardHelper.HasNextStep before calling this

tr.td: Object to use for the action ID argument.

section.title: LinkToNext(System.String linkText, System.Object id, System.Collections.IDictionary attributes) : System.String

p.p: Creates an anchor tag (link) with an id attribute to the next step.

note.p: This helper assumes there is a previous step. It's advised that you use Castle.MonoRail.Framework.Helpers.WizardHelper.HasNextStep before calling this

tr.td: Object to use for the action ID argument.
Additional attributes for the a tag.

p.p: Creates an anchor tag (link) to the previous step.

note.p: This helper assumes there is a previous step. It's advised that you use Castle.MonoRail.Framework.Helpers.WizardHelper.HasPreviousStep before calling this

p.p: Creates an anchor tag (link) to the previous step.

note.p: This helper assumes there is a previous step. It's advised that you use Castle.MonoRail.Framework.Helpers.WizardHelper.HasPreviousStep before calling this

tr.td: Additional attributes for the a tag.

p.p: Creates an anchor tag (link) with an id attribute to the previous step.

note.p: This helper assumes there is a previous step. It's advised that you use Castle.MonoRail.Framework.Helpers.WizardHelper.HasPreviousStep before calling this

tr.td: Object to use for the action ID argument.

section.title: LinkToPrevious(System.String linkText, System.Object id, System.Collections.IDictionary attributes) : System.String

p.p: Creates an anchor tag (link) with an id attribute to the previous step.

note.p: This helper assumes there is a previous step. It's advised that you use Castle.MonoRail.Framework.Helpers.WizardHelper.HasPreviousStep before calling this

tr.td: Object to use for the action ID argument.
Additional attributes for the a tag.

section.title: FieldSet(System.String legend) : System.String
section.p:
Creates a fieldset
tag with a legend. <fieldset><legend>legendArg</legend>

section.title: EndFieldSet() : System.String
section.p:
Creates a closing fieldset
tag. </fieldset>

section.title: Form(System.String action) : System.String
section.p:
Creates a form tag with "post" method and specified action
. <form method="post" action="actionArg">

section.title: Form(System.String action, System.String id, System.String method) : System.String
section.p:
Creates a form tag with specified method, action and id
. <form method="methodArg" action="actionArg" id="idArg">

section.title: Form(System.String action, System.String id, System.String method, System.String onSubmit) : System.String
section.p:
Creates a form tag with specified method, action, id and onSubmit
event handler. <form method="methodArg" action="actionArg" id="idArg" onsubmit="onSubmitArg">

section.title: Form(System.String action, System.Collections.IDictionary attributes) : System.String
section.p:
Creates a form tag the specified action
. <form action="actionArg">

section.title: EndForm() : System.String
section.p:
Creates a closing form
tag. </form>

section.title: Link(System.String target, System.String linkText) : System.String
section.p: Creates an anchor (link) to the target linkText

section.title: Link(System.String target, System.String linkText, System.Collections.IDictionary attributes) : System.String
section.p: Creates an anchor (link) to the target linkText

section.title: LinkTo(System.String name, System.String action) : System.String
section.p: Creates an anchor (link) to the action on the current controller. nameArg

section.title: LinkTo(System.String name, System.String controller, System.String action) : System.String
section.p: Creates an anchor (link) to the action on the specified controller . nameArg

section.title: LinkTo(System.String name, System.String controller, System.String action, System.Object id) : System.String
section.p: Creates an anchor (link) to the action on the specified controller passing provided id . nameArg

section.title: LinkToAttributed(System.String name, System.String controller, System.String action, System.Collections.IDictionary attributes) : System.String
section.p: Creates an anchor (link) to the action on the specified controller nameArg

section.title: LinkToAttributed(System.String name, System.String controller, System.String action, System.Object id, System.Collections.IDictionary attributes) : System.String
section.p: Creates an anchor (link) to the action on the specified controller nameArg

section.title: MapToVirtual(System.String target) : System.String
section.p:
Maps target
to website virtual path. /website/targetArg

section.title: LabelFor(System.String forId, System.String label) : System.String
section.p:
Creates a label for the element indicated with forId
. <label for="forIdArg">labelArg</label>

section.title: LabelFor(System.String forId, System.String label, System.Collections.IDictionary attributes) : System.String
section.p:
Creates a label for the element indicated with forId
. <label key1="value1" key2="value2" for="forIdArg">labelArg</label>

section.title: DateTime(System.String name, System.DateTime value) : System.String
section.p:
Creates three select
tags to input day, month and year. <select name="nameArgday" id="nameArgday" > ... </select> <select name="nameArgmonth" id="nameArgmonth" > ... </select> <select name="nameArgyear" id="nameArgyear" > ... </select>

section.title: DateTime(System.String name, System.DateTime value, System.Collections.IDictionary attributes) : System.String
section.p:
Creates three select
tags to input day, month and year. <select name="nameArgday" id="nameArgday" key1="value1" key3="value3" key2="value2" > ... </select> <select name="nameArgmonth" id="nameArgmonth" key1="value1" key3="value3" key2="value2" > ... </select> <select name="nameArgyear" id="nameArgyear" key1="value1" key3="value3" key2="value2" > ... </select>

section.title: TextArea(System.String name, System.Int32 cols, System.Int32 rows, System.String value) : System.String

p.p: Creates a text area element.
Creates an input element of the button type.
Creates an input element of the button type.

section.title: InputButton(System.String name, System.String value, System.Collections.IDictionary attributes) : System.String

p.p: Creates an input element of the button type.

section.title: InputCheckbox(System.String name, System.Object value, System.Boolean isChecked) : System.String
InputCheckbox(System.String name, System.Object value, System.Collections.IDictionary attributes) : System.String
InputRadio(System.String name, System.Object value, System.Collections.IDictionary attributes) : System.String

p.p: Creates an input element of the text type.

section.title: InputText(System.String name, System.String value, System.Int32 size, System.Int32 maxlength) : System.String
section.p:
Creates an input element of the text type of specified size and maxlength
. <input type="text" name="nameArg" id="nameArg" value="valueArg" size="10" maxlength="10" />

section.title: InputText(System.String name, System.String value, System.Int32 size, System.Int32 maxlength, System.Collections.IDictionary attributes) : System.String
section.p:
Creates an input element of the text type with specified size, maxlength and attributes
. <input type="text" name="nameArg" id="nameArg" value="valueArg" size="10" maxlength="10" />

section.title: InputText(System.String name, System.String value, System.String id) : System.String
section.p:
Creates an input element of the text type with custom name and id
. <input type="text" name="nameArg" id="idArg" value="valueArg" />

section.title: InputText(System.String name, System.String value, System.Collections.IDictionary attributes) : System.String
InputPassword(System.String name) : System.String
section.p: Creates an input element of password type

section.title: InputPassword(System.String name, System.String value) : System.String
section.p: Creates an input element of password type

section.title: InputPassword(System.String name, System.String value, System.Collections.IDictionary attributes) : System.String
section.p: Creates an input element of password type

section.title: InputHidden(System.String name, System.String value) : System.String
section.p: Creates an input hidden element

p.p: Creates a hidden type input element.
Creates a submit button.
Creates a submit button.

section.title: Select(System.String name) : System.String
section.p:
Creates opening select
tag. <select name="nameArg" id="nameArg">

section.title: Select(System.String name, System.Collections.IDictionary attributes) : System.String
section.p:
Creates opening select
tag. <select name="nameArg" id="nameArg" key1="value1" key2="value2" >

section.title: EndSelect() : System.String
section.p: Creates a closing select tag.

section.title: OptionGroup(System.String label) : System.String

section.p: TODO: Document this!

section.title: CreateOption(System.String text, System.Object value, System.Collections.IDictionary htmlAttributes) : System.String
section.p: TODO: Document this!

section.title: CreateOptionsFromPrimitiveArray(System.Array elems, System.String selected) : System.String
section.p:
Creates option elements from System.Array. Marks the option that matches the selected
argument (if provided). <option>0</option> <option>1</option> ... <option>5</option> <option selected>selectedArg</option> <option>object</option>

section.title: CreateOptionsFromArray(System.Array elems, System.String textProperty, System.String valueProperty) : System.String
section.p:
Creates options elements from an System.Array
. <option value="valueProp">textProp</option> <option value="0">textProp2</option> <option value="5">textProp3</option>

section.title: CreateOptionsFromArray(System.Array elems, System.String textProperty, System.String valueProperty, System.Object selectedValue) : System.String
section.p:
Creates options elements from an System.Array
. <option value="valueProp" selected>textProp</option> <option value="0">textProp2</option> <option value="5">textProp3</option>

section.title: CreateOptions(System.Collections.ICollection elems, System.String textProperty, System.String valueProperty) : System.String
section.p:
Creates options elements from an System.Collections.ICollection
. <option value="valueProp">textProp</option> <option value="0">textProp2</option> <option value="5">textProp3</option>

section.title: CreateOptions(System.Collections.ICollection elems, System.String textProperty, System.String valueProperty, System.Object selectedValue) : System.String
section.p:
Creates options elements from an System.Collections.ICollection
. <option value="valueProp" selected>textProp</option> <option value="0">textProp2</option> <option value="5">textProp3</option>

section.title: BuildUnorderedList(System.Collections.ICollection elements) : System.String
section.p:
Builds an unordered ul list from supplied System.Collections.ICollection .
  • 0
    • ...
  • object

section.title: BuildUnorderedList(System.Collections.ICollection elements, System.String styleClass, System.String itemClass) : System.String
section.p:
Builds an unordered ul list from supplied System.Collections.ICollection with ul and li tags CSS class set to supplied attributes.
  1. 0
    2. ...
  2. object

section.title: BuildOrderedList(System.Collections.ICollection elements) : System.String
section.p:
Builds an ordered ol list from supplied System.Collections.ICollection .

    2. ...
  2. object

section.title: BuildOrderedList(System.Collections.ICollection elements, System.String styleClass, System.String itemClass) : System.String
section.p:
Builds an ordered ol list from supplied System.Collections.ICollection with ol and li tags CSS class set to supplied attributes.
  1. 0
    2. ...
  2. object

section.title: MergeOptions(System.Collections.IDictionary userOptions, System.Collections.IDictionary defaultOptions)
section.p: Merges userOptions with defaultOptions placing results in userOptions.

section.title: GetAttributes(System.Collections.IDictionary attributes) : System.String
section.p:
Generates HTML element attributes string from attributes
. key1="value1" key2

section.title: HtmlEncode(System.String content) : System.String
section.p: HTML encodes a string and returns the encoded string.

section.title: UrlEncode(System.String content) : System.String
section.p: URL encodes a string and returns the encoded string.

section.title: UrlPathEncode(System.String content) : System.String
section.p: URL encodes the path portion of a URL string and returns the encoded string.

section.title: JavaScriptEscape(System.String content) : System.String
section.p: Escapes JavaScript with Url encoding and returns the encoded string.

p.p: Generates script block.
